get.description: Get a list of visible groups for the authenticated user. When accessed without authentication, only public groups are returned.

parameters.name: skip_groups
parameters.description: Skip the group IDs passed

parameters.name: all_available
parameters.description: Show all the groups you have access to (defaults to false for authenticated users, true for administrators); Attributes owned and min_access_level have precedence

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Return the list of authorized groups matching the search criteria

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order groups by name, path, id, or similarity (if searching, introduced in GitLab 14.1). Default is name

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Order groups in asc or desc order. Default is asc

parameters.name: statistics
parameters.description: Include group statistics (administrators only)

parameters.name: with_custom_attributes
parameters.description: Include custom attributes in response (administrators only)

parameters.name: owned
parameters.description: Limit to groups explicitly owned by the current user

parameters.name: min_access_level
parameters.description: Limit to groups where current user has at least this access level

parameters.name: top_level_only
parameters.description: Limit to top level groups, excluding all subgroups

get.description: Get a list of visible direct subgroups in this group. When accessed without authentication, only public groups are returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group of the immediate parent group

parameters.name: skip_groups
parameters.description: Skip the group IDs passed

parameters.name: all_available
parameters.description: Show all the groups you have access to (defaults to false for authenticated users, true for administrators); Attributes owned and min_access_level have precedence

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Return the list of authorized groups matching the search criteria. Only subgroup short paths are searched (not full paths)

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order groups by name, path or id. Default is name

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Order groups in asc or desc order. Default is asc

parameters.name: statistics
parameters.description: Include group statistics (administrators only)

parameters.name: with_custom_attributes
parameters.description: Include custom attributes in response (administrators only)

parameters.name: owned
parameters.description: Limit to groups explicitly owned by the current user

parameters.name: min_access_level
parameters.description: Limit to groups where current user has at least this access level

get.description: Get a list of visible descendant groups of this group. When accessed without authentication, only public groups are returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group of the immediate parent group

parameters.name: skip_groups
parameters.description: Skip the group IDs passed

parameters.name: all_available
parameters.description: Show all the groups you have access to (defaults to false for authenticated users, true for administrators). Attributes owned and min_access_level have precedence

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Return the list of authorized groups matching the search criteria. Only descendant group short paths are searched (not full paths)

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order groups by name, path, or id. Default is name

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Order groups in asc or desc order. Default is asc

parameters.name: statistics
parameters.description: Include group statistics (administrators only)

parameters.name: with_custom_attributes
parameters.description: Include custom attributes in response (administrators only)

parameters.name: owned
parameters.description: Limit to groups explicitly owned by the current user

parameters.name: min_access_level
parameters.description: Limit to groups where current user has at least this access level

get.description: Get a list of projects in this group. When accessed without authentication, only public projects are returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Limit by archived status

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Limit by visibility public, internal, or private

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Return projects ordered by id, name, path, created_at, updated_at, similarity (1), or last_activity_at fields. Default is created_at

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Return projects sorted in asc or desc order. Default is desc

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Return list of authorized projects matching the search criteria

parameters.name: simple
parameters.description: Return only the ID, URL, name, and path of each project

parameters.name: owned
parameters.description: Limit by projects owned by the current user

parameters.name: starred
parameters.description: Limit by projects starred by the current user

parameters.name: with_issues_enabled
parameters.description: Limit by projects with issues feature enabled. Default is false

parameters.name: with_merge_requests_enabled
parameters.description: Limit by projects with merge requests feature enabled. Default is false

parameters.name: with_shared
parameters.description: Include projects shared to this group. Default is true

parameters.name: include_subgroups
parameters.description: Include projects in subgroups of this group. Default is false

parameters.name: min_access_level
parameters.description: Limit to projects where current user has at least this access level

parameters.name: with_custom_attributes
parameters.description: Include custom attributes in response (administrators only)

parameters.name: with_security_reports
parameters.description: Return only projects that have security reports artifacts present in any of their builds. This means “projects with security reports enabled”. Default is false

get.description: Get a list of projects shared to this group. When accessed without authentication, only public shared projects are returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Limit by archived status

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Limit by visibility public, internal, or private

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Return projects ordered by id, name, path, created_at, updated_at, or last_activity_at fields. Default is created_at

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Return projects sorted in asc or desc order. Default is desc

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Return list of authorized projects matching the search criteria

parameters.name: simple
parameters.description: Return only the ID, URL, name, and path of each project

parameters.name: starred
parameters.description: Limit by projects starred by the current user

parameters.name: with_issues_enabled
parameters.description: Limit by projects with issues feature enabled. Default is false

parameters.name: with_merge_requests_enabled
parameters.description: Limit by projects with merge requests feature enabled. Default is false

parameters.name: min_access_level
parameters.description: Limit to projects where current user has at least this access level

parameters.name: with_custom_attributes
parameters.description: Include custom attributes in response (administrators only)

get.description: Get all details of a group. This endpoint can be accessed without authentication if the group is publicly accessible. In case the user that requests is an administrator if the group is publicly accessible. With authentication, it returns the runners_token for the group too, if the user is an administrator or group owner.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group owned by the authenticated user.

parameters.name: with_custom_attributes
parameters.description: Include custom attributes in response (administrators only).

parameters.name: with_projects
parameters.description: Include details from projects that belong to the specified group (defaults to true). (Deprecated, scheduled for removal in API v5. To get the details of all projects within a group, use the list a group’s projects endpoint.)

get.description: Get a group avatar. This endpoint can be accessed without authentication if the group is publicly accessible.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the group

post.description: Creates a new project group. Available only for users who can create groups.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the group.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the group.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The group’s description.

parameters.name: membership_lock
parameters.description: Prevent adding new members to projects within this group.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: The group’s visibility. Can be private, internal, or public.

parameters.name: share_with_group_lock
parameters.description: Prevent sharing a project with another group within this group.

parameters.name: require_two_factor_authentication
parameters.description: Require all users in this group to setup Two-factor authentication.

parameters.name: two_factor_grace_period
parameters.description: Time before Two-factor authentication is enforced (in hours).

parameters.name: project_creation_level
parameters.description: Determine if developers can create projects in the group. Can be noone (No one), maintainer (users with the Maintainer role), or developer (users with the Developer or Maintainer role).

parameters.name: auto_devops_enabled
parameters.description: Default to Auto DevOps pipeline for all projects within this group.

parameters.name: subgroup_creation_level
parameters.description: Allowed to create subgroups. Can be owner (Owners), or maintainer (users with the Maintainer role).

parameters.name: emails_disabled
parameters.description: Disable email notifications

parameters.name: avatar
parameters.description: Image file for avatar of the group. Introduced in GitLab 12.9

parameters.name: mentions_disabled
parameters.description: Disable the capability of a group from getting mentioned

parameters.name: lfs_enabled
parameters.description: Enable/disable Large File Storage (LFS) for the projects in this group.

parameters.name: request_access_enabled
parameters.description: Allow users to request member access.

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: The parent group ID for creating nested group.

parameters.name: default_branch_protection
parameters.description: See Options for default_branch_protection. Default to the global level default branch protection setting.

parameters.name: shared_runners_minutes_limit
parameters.description: Can be set by administrators only. Maximum number of monthly CI/CD minutes for this group. Can be nil (default; inherit system default), 0 (unlimited), or > 0.

parameters.name: extra_shared_runners_minutes_limit
parameters.description: Can be set by administrators only. Additional CI/CD minutes for this group.

post.description: Transfer a project to the Group namespace. Available only to instance administrators, although an alternative API endpoint is available which does not require administrator access on the instance. Transferring projects may fail when tagged packages exist in the project’s repository.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the target group

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project

post.summary: Transfer a group to a new parent group / Turn a subgroup to a top-level group
post.description: Transfer a group to a new parent group or turn a subgroup to a top-level group. Available to administrators and users:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the group to transfer.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: ID of the new parent group. When not specified, the group to transfer is instead turned into a top-level group.

put.description: Updates the project group. Only available to group owners and administrators.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the group.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the group.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the group.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the group.

parameters.name: membership_lock
parameters.description: Prevent adding new members to projects within this group.

parameters.name: share_with_group_lock
parameters.description: Prevent sharing a project with another group within this group.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: The visibility level of the group. Can be private, internal, or public.

parameters.name: require_two_factor_authentication
parameters.description: Require all users in this group to setup Two-factor authentication.

parameters.name: two_factor_grace_period
parameters.description: Time before Two-factor authentication is enforced (in hours).

parameters.name: project_creation_level
parameters.description: Determine if developers can create projects in the group. Can be noone (No one), maintainer (users with the Maintainer role), or developer (users with the Developer or Maintainer role).

parameters.name: auto_devops_enabled
parameters.description: Default to Auto DevOps pipeline for all projects within this group.

parameters.name: subgroup_creation_level
parameters.description: Allowed to create subgroups. Can be owner (Owners), or maintainer (users with the Maintainer role).

parameters.name: emails_disabled
parameters.description: Disable email notifications

parameters.name: avatar
parameters.description: Image file for avatar of the group. Introduced in GitLab 12.9

parameters.name: mentions_disabled
parameters.description: Disable the capability of a group from getting mentioned

parameters.name: lfs_enabled (optional)
parameters.description: Enable/disable Large File Storage (LFS) for the projects in this group.

parameters.name: request_access_enabled
parameters.description: Allow users to request member access.

parameters.name: default_branch_protection
parameters.description: See Options for default_branch_protection.

parameters.name: file_template_project_id
parameters.description: The ID of a project to load custom file templates from.

parameters.name: shared_runners_minutes_limit
parameters.description: Can be set by administrators only. Maximum number of monthly CI/CD minutes for this group. Can be nil (default; inherit system default), 0 (unlimited), or > 0.

parameters.name: extra_shared_runners_minutes_limit
parameters.description: Can be set by administrators only. Additional CI/CD minutes for this group.

parameters.name: prevent_forking_outside_group
parameters.description: When enabled, users can not fork projects from this group to external namespaces

parameters.name: shared_runners_setting
parameters.description: See Options for shared_runners_setting. Enable or disable shared runners for a group’s subgroups and projects.

parameters.name: prevent_sharing_groups_outside_hierarchy
parameters.description: See Prevent group sharing outside the group hierarchy. This attribute is only available on top-level groups. Introduced in GitLab 14.1

delete.description: Only available to group owners and administrators.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

post.description: Restores a group marked for deletion.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

get.description: Get all groups that match your string in their name or path.
Get a list of users provisioned by a given group. Does not include users provisioned by subgroups.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Return single user with a specific username

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search users by name, email, username

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Return only active users

parameters.name: blocked
parameters.description: Return only blocked users

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Return users created after the specified time

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Return users created before the specified time

get.description: Get a list of group hooks

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

get.description: Get a specific hook for a group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: hook_id
parameters.description: The ID of a group hook

post.description: Adds a hook to a specified group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The hook URL

parameters.name: push_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on push events

parameters.name: issues_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on issues events

parameters.name: confidential_issues_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on confidential issues events

parameters.name: merge_requests_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on merge requests events

parameters.name: tag_push_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on tag push events

parameters.name: note_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on note events

parameters.name: confidential_note_events

parameters.name: wiki_page_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on wiki page events

parameters.description: Trigger hook on deployment events

parameters.name: releases_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on release events

parameters.name: subgroup_events
parameters.description: Trigger hook on subgroup events

parameters.name: enable_ssl_verification
parameters.description: Do SSL verification when triggering the hook

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Secret token to validate received payloads; not returned in the response

delete.description: Removes a hook from a group. This is an idempotent method and can be called multiple times. Either the hook is available or not.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: hook_id
parameters.description: The ID of the group hook.

post.description: Syncs the group with its linked LDAP group. Only available to group owners and administrators.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

post.summary: Add LDAP group link with CN or filter
post.description: Adds an LDAP group link using a CN or filter. Adding a group link by filter is only supported in the Premium tier and above.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: cn
parameters.description: The CN of an LDAP group

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The LDAP filter for the group

parameters.name: group_access
parameters.description: Minimum access level for members of the LDAP group

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: LDAP provider for the LDAP group link

delete.description: Deletes an LDAP group link. Deprecated. Scheduled for removal in a future release.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: cn
parameters.description: The CN of an LDAP group

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: LDAP provider for the LDAP group link

delete.summary: Delete LDAP group link with CN or filter
delete.description: Deletes an LDAP group link using a CN or filter. Deleting by filter is only supported in the Premium tier and above.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: cn
parameters.description: The CN of an LDAP group

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The LDAP filter for the group

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: LDAP provider for the LDAP group link

post.summary: Create a link to share a group with another group
post.description: Share group with another group. Returns 200 and the group details on success.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the group to share with

parameters.name: group_access
parameters.description: The access level to grant the group

parameters.name: expires_at
parameters.description: Share expiration date in ISO 8601 format: 2016-09-26

delete.summary: Delete link sharing group with another group
delete.description: Unshare the group from another group. Returns 204 and no content on success.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the group to share with

get.description: Get the push rules of a group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the group or URL-encoded path of the group

post.description: Adds push rules to the specified group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: deny_delete_tag
parameters.description: Deny deleting a tag

parameters.name: member_check
parameters.description: Allows only GitLab users to author commits

parameters.name: prevent_secrets
parameters.description: Files that are likely to contain secrets are rejected

parameters.name: commit_message_regex
parameters.description: All commit messages must match the regular expression provided in this attribute, for example, Fixed \d+\..*

parameters.name: commit_message_negative_regex
parameters.description: Commit messages matching the regular expression provided in this attribute aren’t allowed, for example, ssh\:\/\/

parameters.name: branch_name_regex
parameters.description: All branch names must match the regular expression provided in this attribute, for example, (feature|hotfix)\/*

parameters.name: author_email_regex
parameters.description: All commit author emails must match the regular expression provided in this attribute, for example, @my-company.com$

parameters.name: file_name_regex
parameters.description: Filenames matching the regular expression provided in this attribute are not allowed, for example, (jar|exe)$

parameters.name: max_file_size
parameters.description: Maximum file size (MB) allowed

parameters.name: commit_committer_check
parameters.description: Only commits pushed using verified emails are allowed

parameters.name: reject_unsigned_commits
parameters.description: Only commits signed through GPG are allowed

put.description: Edit push rules for a specified group.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the group

parameters.name: deny_delete_tag
parameters.description: Deny deleting a tag

parameters.name: member_check
parameters.description: Restricts commits to be authored by existing GitLab users only

parameters.name: prevent_secrets
parameters.description: Files that are likely to contain secrets are rejected

parameters.name: commit_message_regex
parameters.description: All commit messages must match the regular expression provided in this attribute, for example, Fixed \d+\..*

parameters.name: commit_message_negative_regex
parameters.description: Commit messages matching the regular expression provided in this attribute aren’t allowed, for example, ssh\:\/\/

parameters.name: branch_name_regex
parameters.description: All branch names must match the regular expression provided in this attribute, for example, (feature|hotfix)\/*

parameters.name: author_email_regex
parameters.description: All commit author emails must match the regular expression provided in this attribute, for example, @my-company.com$

parameters.name: file_name_regex
parameters.description: Filenames matching the regular expression provided in this attribute are not allowed, for example, (jar|exe)$

parameters.name: max_file_size
parameters.description: Maximum file size (MB) allowed

parameters.name: commit_committer_check
parameters.description: Only commits pushed using verified emails are allowed

parameters.name: reject_unsigned_commits
parameters.description: Only commits signed through GPG are allowed
